  48def getScreenSize(app):
  49    screens = app.screens()
  50    res = list(map(lambda x: x.size(), screens))
  51    return res
  52# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  53# --- Class GalleryMode -------------------------------------------------------
  54# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  55class GalleryMode(enum.Enum):
  56    """ Enum  """
  57
  58    _1x1         = 0         # 
  59    _3x2         = 1         # 
  60    _6x4         = 2         # 
  61    _9x6         = 3         #
  62    
  63    _2x1        =  4
  64
  65    def nbRow(m):
  66        if m == GalleryMode._1x1: return 1
  67        if m == GalleryMode._3x2: return 2
  68        if m == GalleryMode._6x4: return 4
  69        if m == GalleryMode._9x6: return 6
  70
  71        if m == GalleryMode._2x1: return 1
  72    def nbCol(m):
  73        if m == GalleryMode._1x1: return 1
  74        if m == GalleryMode._3x2: return 3
  75        if m == GalleryMode._6x4: return 6
  76        if m == GalleryMode._9x6: return 9
  77
  78        if m == GalleryMode._2x1: return 2
  79# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  80# --- Class ImageWidgetController ---------------------------------------------
  81# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  82class ImageWidgetController:
  83    """ image widget controller """
  84
  85    def __init__(self, image=None,id = -1):
  86
  87        self.model = model.ImageWidgetModel(self)
  88        self.view = view.ImageWidgetView(self)
  89
  90        self._id = id # store an (unique) id 
  91
  92        if isinstance(image, (np.ndarray, hdrCore.image.Image)):
  93            self.model.setImage(image)
  94            self.view.setPixmap(self.model.getColorData())
  95
  96    def setImage(self, image):
  97        self.model.setImage(image)
  98        return self.view.setPixmap(self.model.getColorData())
  99
 100    def setQPixmap(self, qPixmap):
 101        self.view.setQPixmap(qPixmap)
 102
 103    def id(self): return self._id
 104# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 105# --- Class ImageGalleryController --------------------------------------------
 106# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 107class ImageGalleryController():
 108    """ image gallery controller """
 109
 110    def __init__(self, parent):
 111        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> ImageGalleryController.__init__()")
 112
 113        self.parent = parent    # AppView
 114        self.view = view.ImageGalleryView(self)
 115        self.model = model.ImageGalleryModel(self)
 116
 117    def setImages(self, imageFiles): self.model.setImages(imageFiles)
 118
 119    def updateImages(self):
 120        """ called by ImageGalleryModel to ask for update images """
 121        self.view.pageNumber = 0 # reset page number
 122        self.view.updateImages()
 123
 124    def callBackButton_previousPage(self):  
 125        self.view.changePageNumber(-1)
 126        if self.view.shapeMode == GalleryMode._1x1 : self.selectImage(0)
 127
 128    def callBackButton_nextPage(self):      
 129        self.view.changePageNumber(+1)
 130        if self.view.shapeMode == GalleryMode._1x1 : self.selectImage(0)
 131
 132    def computePageNumberOnGalleryModeChange(self,newGalleryMode):
 133        currentPage = self.view.pageNumber
 134        nbImagePerPage = GalleryMode.nbRow(self.view.shapeMode)*GalleryMode.nbCol(self.view.shapeMode)
 135        selectedImage = self.model.selectedImage() if (self.model.selectedImage()!=-1) else currentPage*nbImagePerPage
 136        newNbImagePerPage = GalleryMode.nbRow(newGalleryMode)*GalleryMode.nbCol(newGalleryMode)
 137
 138        newPageNumber = selectedImage//newNbImagePerPage
 139
 140        return newPageNumber
 141
 142    def callBackButton_1x1(self):
 143        if self.view.shapeMode != GalleryMode._1x1:
 144            self.view.resetGridLayoutWidgets()
 145            self.view.pageNumber = self.computePageNumberOnGalleryModeChange(GalleryMode._1x1)
 146            self.view.shapeMode = GalleryMode._1x1
 147            self.view.buildGridLayoutWidgets()
 148            self.view.updateImages()
 149            self.model.loadPage(self.view.pageNumber)
 150            self.view.repaint()
 151
 152    def callBackButton_3x2(self): 
 153        if self.view.shapeMode != GalleryMode._3x2:
 154            self.view.resetGridLayoutWidgets()
 155            self.view.pageNumber = self.computePageNumberOnGalleryModeChange(GalleryMode._3x2)
 156            self.view.shapeMode = GalleryMode._3x2
 157            self.view.buildGridLayoutWidgets()
 158            self.view.updateImages()
 159            self.model.loadPage(self.view.pageNumber)
 160            self.view.repaint()
 161
 162    def callBackButton_6x4(self): 
 163        if self.view.shapeMode != GalleryMode._6x4:
 164            self.view.resetGridLayoutWidgets()
 165            self.view.pageNumber = self.computePageNumberOnGalleryModeChange(GalleryMode._6x4)
 166            self.view.shapeMode = GalleryMode._6x4
 167            self.view.buildGridLayoutWidgets()
 168            self.view.updateImages()
 169            self.model.loadPage(self.view.pageNumber)
 170            self.view.repaint()
 171
 172    def callBackButton_9x6(self):
 173        if self.view.shapeMode != GalleryMode._9x6:
 174            self.view.resetGridLayoutWidgets()
 175            self.view.pageNumber = self.computePageNumberOnGalleryModeChange(GalleryMode._9x6)
 176            self.view.shapeMode = GalleryMode._9x6
 177            self.view.buildGridLayoutWidgets()
 178            self.view.updateImages()
 179            self.model.loadPage(self.view.pageNumber)
 180            self.view.repaint()
 181
 182    def callBackButton_2x1(self):
 183        if self.view.shapeMode != GalleryMode._2x1:
 184            self.view.resetGridLayoutWidgets()
 185            self.view.pageNumber = self.computePageNumberOnGalleryModeChange(GalleryMode._2x1)
 186            self.view.shapeMode = GalleryMode._2x1
 187            self.view.buildGridLayoutWidgets()
 188            self.view.updateImages()
 189            self.model.loadPage(self.view.pageNumber)
 190            self.view.repaint()
 191
 192    def selectImage(self, id):
 193        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> ImageGalleryController.selectImage()")
 194
 195        nbImagePage = GalleryMode.nbRow(self.view.shapeMode)*GalleryMode.nbCol(self.view.shapeMode)
 196        idxImage = self.view.pageNumber*nbImagePage+id
 197        # check id
 198        if (idxImage < len(self.model.processPipes)):
 199            # update selected image
 200            processPipe = self.model.processPipes[idxImage]
 201            if processPipe:
 202                if self.parent.dock.setProcessPipe(processPipe):
 203                    self.model.setSelectedImage(idxImage)
 204
 205    def getSelectedProcessPipe(self):
 206        if pref.verbose:  print(" [CONTROL] >> ImageGalleryController.getSelectedProcessPipe()")
 207        return self.model.getSelectedProcessPipe()
 208
 209    def setProcessPipeWidgetQPixmap(self, qPixmap):
 210        idxProcessPipe = self.model.selectedImage()
 211        nbImagePage = GalleryMode.nbRow(self.view.shapeMode)*GalleryMode.nbCol(self.view.shapeMode)
 212        idxImageWidget = idxProcessPipe%nbImagePage
 213        if pref.verbose:  print(" >> ImageGalleryController.setProcessPipeWidgetQPixmap(...)[ image id:",idxProcessPipe,">> image widget controller:",idxImageWidget,"]")
 214        self.view.imagesControllers[idxImageWidget].setQPixmap(qPixmap)
 215
 216    def save(self):
 217        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> ImageGalleryController.save()")
 218        self.model.save()
 219
 220    def currentPage(self): return self.view.currentPage()
 221
 222    def pageIdx(self):
 223        nb = self.currentPage()
 224        nbImagePage = GalleryMode.nbRow(self.view.shapeMode)*GalleryMode.nbCol(self.view.shapeMode)
 225        return (nb*nbImagePage), ((nb+1)*nbImagePage)
 226
 227    def getFilenamesOfCurrentPage(self): return self.model.getFilenamesOfCurrentPage()
 228
 229    def getProcessPipeById(self,i) : return self.model.getProcessPipeById(i)
 230
 231    def getProcessPipes(self): return self.model.processPipes
 232# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 233# --- Class AppController -----------------------------------------------------
 234# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 235class AppController(object):
 236    """controller for MainWindow
 237    
 238        Attributes:
 239            screenSize 
 240            hdrDisplay 
 241            view                          
 242            model
 243            
 244        Methods:
 245            callBackSelectDir(self)
 246            callBackSave(self)
 247            callBackDisplayHDR(self)
 248            callBackEndDisplay(self, img)
 249            callBackCloseDisplayHDR(self)
 250            callBackCompareRawEditedHDR(self)
 251            callBackExportHDR(self)
 252            callBackEndExportHDR(self, img)
 253            callBackExportAllHDR(self)            
 254            callBackEndAllExportHDR(self, img)  
 255
 256    """
 257
 258    def __init__(self, app):
 259        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> AppController.__init__()")
 260
 261        self.screenSize = getScreenSize(app)# get screens size
 262
 263        # attributes
 264        self.hdrDisplay = HDRviewerController(self)
 265        self.view =  view.AppView(self, HDRcontroller = self.hdrDisplay)                         
 266        self.model = model.AppModel(self)
 267
 268        self.dirName = None
 269        self.imagesName = []
 270        
 271        self.view.show()
 272    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 273
 274    def callBackSelectDir(self):
 275        """Callback of export HDR menu: open file dialog, store image filenames (self.imagesName), set directory to model
 276        """
 277        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> AppController.callBackSelectDir()")
 278        dirName = QFileDialog.getExistingDirectory(None, 'Select Directory', self.model.directory)
 279        if dirName != "":
 280            # save current images (metadata)
 281            self.view.imageGalleryController.save()
 282            # get images in the selected directory
 283            self.imagesName = []; self.imagesName = list(self.model.setDirectory(dirName))
 284
 285            self.view.imageGalleryController.setImages(self.imagesName)
 286            self.hdrDisplay.displaySplash()
 287    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 288    def callBackSave(self): self.view.imageGalleryController.save()
 289    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 290    def callBackQuit(self):
 291        if pref.verbose: print(" [CB] >> AppController.callBackQuit()")
 292        self.view.imageGalleryController.save()
 293        self.hdrDisplay.close()
 294        sys.exit()
 295    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 296    def callBackDisplayHDR(self):
 297
 298        if pref.verbose:  print(" [CONTROL] >> AppController.callBackDisplayHDR()")
 299
 300        selectedProcessPipe = self.view.imageGalleryController.model.getSelectedProcessPipe()
 301
 302        if selectedProcessPipe:
 303            self.view.statusBar().showMessage('displaying HDR image, full size image computation: start, please wait !')
 304            self.view.statusBar().repaint()
 305            # save current processpipe metada
 306            originalImage = copy.deepcopy(selectedProcessPipe.originalImage)
 307            originalImage.metadata.metadata['processpipe'] = selectedProcessPipe.toDict()
 308            originalImage.metadata.save()
 309
 310            # load full size image
 311            img = hdrCore.image.Image.read(originalImage.path+'/'+originalImage.name)
 312
 313            # turn off: autoResize
 314            hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe.autoResize = False 
 315            # make a copy of selectedProcessPipe  
 316            processpipe = copy.deepcopy(selectedProcessPipe)
 317
 318            # set size to display size
 319            size = pref.getDisplayShape()
 320            img = img.process(hdrCore.processing.resize(),size=(None, size[1]))
 321
 322            # set image to process-pipe
 323            processpipe.setImage(img)
 324
 325            thread.cCompute(self.callBackEndDisplay, processpipe, toneMap=False, progress=self.view.statusBar().showMessage)
 326    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 327    def callBackEndDisplay(self, img):
 328
 329        if pref.verbose:  print(" [CONTROL] >> AppController.callBackEndDisplay()")
 330
 331        # turn off: autoResize
 332        hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe.autoResize = True  
 333        
 334        self.view.statusBar().showMessage('displaying HDR image, full size image computation: done !')
 335
 336        # clip, scale
 337        img = img.process(hdrCore.processing.clip())
 338        img.colorData = img.colorData*pref.getDisplayScaling()
 339
 340        colour.write_image(img.colorData,"temp.hdr", method='Imageio') # local copy for display
 341        self.hdrDisplay.displayFile("temp.hdr")
 342    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 343    def callBackCloseDisplayHDR(self):
 344        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> AppController.callBackCloseDisplayHDR()")
 345        self.hdrDisplay.displaySplash()
 346    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 347    def callBackCompareRawEditedHDR(self):
 348        """
 349        Callback of compare raw/edited HDR menu
 350
 351        Display side by side original image and edited version.        
 352        """
 353
 354        if pref.verbose:  print(" [CONTROL] >> AppController.callBackCompareOriginalInputHDR()")
 355
 356        # process real size image
 357        # get selected process pipe
 358        selectedProcessPipe = self.view.imageGalleryController.model.getSelectedProcessPipe()
 359
 360        if selectedProcessPipe:         # check if a process pipe is selected
 361
 362            # read original image
 363            img = hdrCore.image.Image.read(selectedProcessPipe.originalImage.path+'/'+selectedProcessPipe.originalImage.name)
 364
 365            # resize
 366            screenY, screenX = pref.getDisplayShape()
 367
 368            imgY, imgX,_ = img.shape
 369
 370            marginY = int((screenY - imgY/2)/2)
 371            marginX = int(marginY/4)
 372            imgXp = int((screenX - 3*marginX)/2)
 373            img = img.process(hdrCore.processing.resize(),size=(None,imgXp))
 374            imgY, imgX, _ = img.shape
 375
 376            # original image after resize
 377            ori = copy.deepcopy(img)
 378
 379            # build process pipe from selected one them compute
 380            pp = hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe()
 381            hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe.autoResize = False   # stop autoResize
 382            params= []
 383            for p in selectedProcessPipe.processNodes: 
 384                pp.append(copy.deepcopy(p.process),paramDict=None, name=copy.deepcopy(p.name))
 385                params.append({p.name:p.params})
 386            img.metadata.metadata['processpipe'] = params
 387            pp.setImage(img)
 388
 389            res = hdrCore.coreC.coreCcompute(img, pp)
 390            res = res.process(hdrCore.processing.clip())
 391            
 392            imgYres, imgXres, _ = res.colorData.shape
 393
 394            hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe.autoResize = True    # return to autoResize
 395
 396            # make comparison image
 397            oriColorData = ori.colorData*pref.getDisplayScaling()
 398            resColorData = res.colorData*pref.getDisplayScaling()
 399            display = np.ones((screenY,screenX,3))*0.2
 400            marginY = int((screenY - imgY)/2)
 401            marginYres = int((screenY - imgYres)/2)
 402
 403            display[marginY:marginY+imgY, marginX:marginX+imgX,:] = oriColorData
 404            display[marginYres:marginYres+imgYres, 2*marginX+imgX:2*marginX+imgX+imgXres,:] = resColorData
 405            
 406            # save as compOrigFinal.hdr
 407            colour.write_image(display,'compOrigFinal.hdr', method='Imageio')
 408            self.hdrDisplay.displayFile('compOrigFinal.hdr')
 409    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 410    def callBackExportHDR(self):
 411        """
 412        Callback of export HDR menu
 413
 414        Export the image associated to selected process pipe
 415        """
 416
 417        if pref.verbose:  print(" [CONTROL] >> AppController.callBackExportHDR()") 
 418
 419        selectedProcessPipe = self.view.imageGalleryController.model.getSelectedProcessPipe()
 420
 421
 422        if selectedProcessPipe:
 423            # select dir where to save export
 424            self.dirName = QFileDialog.getExistingDirectory(None, 'Select Directory where to export HDR file', self.model.directory)
 425
 426            # show export message
 427            self.view.statusBar().showMessage('exporting HDR image ('+pref.getHDRdisplay()['tag']+'), full size image computation: start, please wait !')
 428            self.view.statusBar().repaint()
 429
 430            # save current processpipe metada
 431            originalImage = copy.deepcopy(selectedProcessPipe.originalImage)
 432            originalImage.metadata.metadata['processpipe'] = selectedProcessPipe.toDict()
 433            originalImage.metadata.save()
 434
 435            # load full size image
 436            img = hdrCore.image.Image.read(originalImage.path+'/'+originalImage.name)
 437
 438            # turn off: autoResize
 439            hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe.autoResize = False 
 440            # make a copy of selectedProcessPipe  
 441            processpipe = copy.deepcopy(selectedProcessPipe)
 442
 443            # set image to process-pipe
 444            processpipe.setImage(img)
 445
 446            thread.cCompute(self.callBackEndExportHDR, processpipe, toneMap=False, progress=self.view.statusBar().showMessage)
 447    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 448    def callBackEndExportHDR(self, img):
 449        # turn off: autoResize
 450        hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe.autoResize = True  
 451        
 452        self.view.statusBar().showMessage('exporting HDR image ('+pref.getHDRdisplay()['tag']+'), full size image computation: done !')
 453
 454        # clip, scale
 455        img = img.process(hdrCore.processing.clip())
 456        img.colorData = img.colorData*pref.getDisplayScaling()
 457
 458        if self.dirName:
 459            pathExport = os.path.join(self.dirName, img.name[:-4]+pref.getHDRdisplay()['post']+'.hdr')
 460            img.type = hdrCore.image.imageType.HDR
 461            img.metadata.metadata['processpipe'] = None
 462            img.metadata.metadata['display'] = pref.getHDRdisplay()['tag']
 463
 464            img.write(pathExport)
 465
 466        colour.write_image(img.colorData,"temp.hdr", method='Imageio') # local copy for display
 467        self.hdrDisplay.displayFile("temp.hdr")
 468    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 469    def callBackExportAllHDR(self):
 470        if pref.verbose:  print(" [CONTROL] >> AppController.callBackExportAllHDR()")
 471
 472        self.processPipes = self.view.imageGalleryController.getProcessPipes()
 473
 474        # select dir where to save export
 475        self.dirName = QFileDialog.getExistingDirectory(None, 'Select Directory where to export HDR file', self.model.directory)
 476        self.view.statusBar().showMessage('exporting '+str(len(self.processPipes))+' HDR images ... please wait')
 477        self.view.statusBar().repaint()
 478        self.imageToExport = len(self.processPipes) ; self.imageExportDone = 0
 479
 480        pp = self.processPipes[0]
 481
 482        # save current processpipe metada
 483        originalImage = copy.deepcopy(pp.originalImage)
 484        originalImage.metadata.metadata['processpipe'] = pp.toDict()
 485        originalImage.metadata.save()
 486
 487        # load full size image
 488        img = hdrCore.image.Image.read(originalImage.path+'/'+originalImage.name)
 489
 490        # turn off: autoResize
 491        hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe.autoResize = False 
 492        # make a copy of selectedProcessPipe  
 493        processpipe = copy.deepcopy(pp)
 494
 495        # set image to process-pipe
 496        processpipe.setImage(img)
 497
 498        thread.cCompute(self.callBackEndAllExportHDR, processpipe, toneMap=False, progress=self.view.statusBar().showMessage)            
 499    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 500    def callBackEndAllExportHDR(self, img):
 501        # last image ?
 502        self.imageExportDone +=1
 503
 504        self.view.statusBar().showMessage('exporting HDR images ('+pref.getHDRdisplay()['tag']+'):'+str(int(100*self.imageExportDone/self.imageToExport))+'% done !')
 505
 506        # clip, scale
 507        img = img.process(hdrCore.processing.clip())
 508        img.colorData = img.colorData*pref.getDisplayScaling()
 509
 510        if self.dirName:
 511            pathExport = os.path.join(self.dirName, img.name[:-4]+pref.getHDRdisplay()['post']+'.hdr')
 512            img.type = hdrCore.image.imageType.HDR
 513            img.metadata.metadata['processpipe'] = None
 514            img.metadata.metadata['display'] = pref.getHDRdisplay()['tag']
 515
 516            img.write(pathExport)
 517
 518        if self.imageExportDone == self.imageToExport :
 519            # turn off: autoResize
 520            hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe.autoResize = True
 521        else:
 522            pp = self.processPipes[self.imageExportDone]
 523
 524            if not pp:
 525                img = hdrCore.image.Image.read(self.imagesName[self.imageExportDone], thumb=True)
 526                pp = model.EditImageModel.buildProcessPipe()
 527                pp.setImage(img)                      
 528
 529
 530            # save current processpipe metada
 531            originalImage = copy.deepcopy(pp.originalImage)
 532            originalImage.metadata.metadata['processpipe'] = pp.toDict()
 533            originalImage.metadata.save()
 534
 535            # load full size image
 536            img = hdrCore.image.Image.read(originalImage.path+'/'+originalImage.name)
 537
 538            # turn off: autoResize
 539            hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe.autoResize = False 
 540            # make a copy of selectedProcessPipe  
 541            processpipe = copy.deepcopy(pp)
 542
 543            # set image to process-pipe
 544            processpipe.setImage(img)
 545
 546            thread.cCompute(self.callBackEndAllExportHDR, processpipe, toneMap=False, progress=self.view.statusBar().showMessage)

 703class AdvanceSliderController():
 704    def __init__(self, parent,name, defaultValue, range, step,callBackValueChange=None,callBackAutoPush= None):
 705        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> AdvanceSliderController.__init__(",") ")
 706        self.parent = parent
 707
 708        self.view = view.AdvanceSliderView(self,  name, defaultValue, range, step)
 709        self.model = model.AdvanceSliderModel(self, value=defaultValue)
 710
 711        self.step = step
 712        self.defaultValue = defaultValue
 713        self.range = range
 714
 715        self.callBackActive = True
 716        self.callBackValueChange = callBackValueChange
 717        self.callBackAutoPush = callBackAutoPush
 718    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 719    def sliderChange(self):
 720
 721        value = self.view.slider.value()*self.step
 722
 723        if pref.verbose: print(" [CB] >> AdvanceSliderController.sliderChange(",value,")[callBackActive:",self.callBackActive,"] ")
 724
 725        self.model.value = value
 726        self.view.editValue.setText(str(value))
 727        if self.callBackActive and self.callBackValueChange: self.callBackValueChange(value)
 728    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 729    def setValue(self, value, callBackActive = True):
 730        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> AdvanceSliderController.setValue(",value,") ")
 731
 732        """ set value value in 'model' range"""
 733        self.callBackActive = callBackActive
 734        self.view.slider.setValue(int(value/self.step))
 735        self.view.editValue.setText(str(value))
 736        self.model.setValue(int(value))
 737
 738        self.callBackActive = True
 739    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 740    def reset(self):
 741        if pref.verbose : print(" [CB] >> AdvanceSliderController.reset(",") ")
 742
 743        self.setValue(self.defaultValue,callBackActive = False)
 744        if self.callBackValueChange: self.callBackValueChange(self.defaultValue)
 745    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 746    def auto(self):
 747        if pref.verbose: print(" [CB] >> AdvanceSliderController.auto(",") ")
 748
 749        if self.callBackAutoPush: self.callBackAutoPush()

 824    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------     
 825    # zj add for semi-auto curve begin
 826    def autoCurve(self):
 827        processPipe = self.parent.controller.model.getProcessPipe()
 828        if processPipe != None :
 829            idExposure = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("tonecurve")
 830            bins = np.linspace(0,1,50+1)
 831
 832            imageBeforeColorData = processPipe.processNodes[idExposure-1].outputImage.colorData
 833            imageBeforeColorData[imageBeforeColorData>1]=1
 834            imageBeforeY = colour.sRGB_to_XYZ(imageBeforeColorData, apply_cctf_decoding=False)[:,:,1]
 835            nphistBefore  = np.histogram(imageBeforeY, bins)[0]
 836            nphistBefore  = nphistBefore/np.amax(nphistBefore)
 837
 838            npImgHistCumuNorm = np.empty_like(nphistBefore)
 839            npImgHistCumu = np.cumsum(nphistBefore)
 840            npImgHistCumuNorm = npImgHistCumu/np.max(npImgHistCumu)
 841            
 842            #predict keypoint value
 843            if self.networkModel == None:
 844                self.networkModel = Net(50,5)
 845                self.networkModel.load_state_dict(torch.load(self.weightFile))
 846                self.networkModel.eval()
 847
 848            with torch.no_grad():
 849                x = Variable(torch.FloatTensor([npImgHistCumuNorm.tolist(),]), requires_grad=True)
 850                y_predict = self.networkModel(x)
 851
 852            kpc = (y_predict[0]*100).tolist() 
 853            kpcDict = {'start':[0.0,0.0], 'shadows': [10.0,kpc[0]], 'blacks': [30.0,kpc[1]], 'mediums': [50.0,kpc[2]], 'whites': [70.0,kpc[3]], 'highlights': [90.0,kpc[4]], 'end': [100.0,100.0]}
 854            self.setValues(kpcDict,callBackActive = True)
 855            self.parent.controller.changeToneCurve(kpcDict) 
 856     
 857    # zj add for semi-auto curve end   
 858
 859    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 860    def reset(self, key):
 861        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> ToneCurveController.reset(",key,") ")
 862
 863        valuesDefault = copy.deepcopy(self.model.default[key])[1]
 864        controls = self.model.setValue(key, valuesDefault)
 865        self.setValues(controls,callBackActive = False)
 866
 867        self.parent.controller.changeToneCurve(controls) 
 868    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 869    def plotCurve(self):
 870        try:
 871            self.view.curve.plot([0,100],[0,100],'r--', clear=True)
 872            self.view.curve.plot([20,20],[0,100],'r--', clear=False)
 873            self.view.curve.plot([40,40],[0,100],'r--', clear=False)
 874            self.view.curve.plot([60,60],[0,100],'r--', clear=False)
 875            self.view.curve.plot([80,80],[0,100],'r--', clear=False)
 876
 877            processPipe = self.parent.controller.model.getProcessPipe()
 878            idExposure = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("tonecurve")
 879
 880            bins = np.linspace(0,1,50+1)
 881
 882            if self.showInput:
 883                imageInput = copy.deepcopy(processPipe.getInputImage())
 884                if imageInput.linear: imageInputColorData =colour.cctf_encoding(imageInput.colorData, function='sRGB')
 885                else: imageInputColorData = imageInput.colorData
 886                imageInputColorData[imageInputColorData>1]=1
 887                imageInputY = colour.sRGB_to_XYZ(imageInputColorData, apply_cctf_decoding=False)[:,:,1]
 888                nphistInput  = np.histogram(imageInputY, bins)[0]
 889                nphistInput  = nphistInput/np.amax(nphistInput)
 890                self.view.curve.plot(bins[:-1]*100,nphistInput*100,'k--',  clear=False)
 891
 892            if self.showbefore:
 893                imageBeforeColorData = processPipe.processNodes[idExposure-1].outputImage.colorData
 894                imageBeforeColorData[imageBeforeColorData>1]=1
 895                imageBeforeY = colour.sRGB_to_XYZ(imageBeforeColorData, apply_cctf_decoding=False)[:,:,1]
 896                nphistBefore  = np.histogram(imageBeforeY, bins)[0]
 897                nphistBefore  = nphistBefore/np.amax(nphistBefore)
 898                self.view.curve.plot(bins[:-1]*100,nphistBefore*100,'b--',  clear=False)
 899
 900            if self.showAfter:
 901                imageAftercolorData = processPipe.processNodes[idExposure].outputImage.colorData
 902                imageAftercolorData[imageAftercolorData>1]=1
 903                imageAfterY  = colour.sRGB_to_XYZ(imageAftercolorData,  apply_cctf_decoding=False)[:,:,1]
 904                nphistAfter   = np.histogram(imageAfterY, bins)[0]
 905                nphistAfter   =nphistAfter/np.amax(nphistAfter)
 906                self.view.curve.plot(bins[:-1]*100,nphistAfter*100,'b',     clear=False)
 907
 908            if self.showOutput:
 909                imageAftercolorData = processPipe.getImage(toneMap=True).colorData
 910                imageAftercolorData[imageAftercolorData>1]=1
 911                imageAfterY  = colour.sRGB_to_XYZ(imageAftercolorData,  apply_cctf_decoding=False)[:,:,1]
 912                nphistAfter   = np.histogram(imageAfterY, bins)[0]
 913                nphistAfter   =nphistAfter/np.amax(nphistAfter)
 914                self.view.curve.plot(bins[:-1]*100,nphistAfter*100,'b',     clear=False)
 915
 916            controlPointCoordinates= np.asarray(list(self.model.control.values()))
 917            self.view.curve.plot(controlPointCoordinates[1:-1,0],controlPointCoordinates[1:-1,1],'ro', clear=False)
 918            points = np.asarray(self.model.curve.evalpts)
 919            x = points[:,0]
 920            self.view.curve.plot(points[x<100,0],points[x<100,1],'r',clear=False)
 921        except:
 922            time.sleep(0.5)
 923            self.plotCurve()

 960class HDRviewerController():
 961    def __init__(self, parent):
 962        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> HDRviewerController.__init__(",")")
 963
 964        self.parent= parent
 965        self.model = model.HDRviewerModel(self)
 966        self.view = None 
 967
 968        self.viewerProcess = None
 969
 970        self.displaySplash()
 971
 972    def setView(self, view): self.view = view
 973
 974    def callBackUpdate(self):
 975        selectedProcessPipe = self.parent.view.imageGalleryController.model.getSelectedProcessPipe()
 976        img = selectedProcessPipe.getImage(toneMap = False)
 977        self.displayIMG(img)
 978        self.model.currentIMG = img
 979
 980    def callBackAuto(self,on_off):
 981        self.parent.view.dock.view.childControllers[0].model.autoPreviewHDR = on_off
 982
 983    def callBackCompare(self):
 984        if self.model.currentIMG:
 985            old = self.model.currentIMG
 986            old = old.process(hdrCore.processing.clip())
 987
 988            sp = self.parent.view.imageGalleryController.model.getSelectedProcessPipe()
 989            img = sp.getImage(toneMap = False)
 990            img = img.process(hdrCore.processing.clip())
 991
 992
 993            h1, w1, _ = old.colorData.shape
 994            h2, w2, _ = img.colorData.shape
 995            hD, wD = self.model.displayModel['shape']
 996            hM = int((hD - max(h1,h2))/2)
 997            wM = int((wD - (w1+w2))/3)
 998            back =  np.ones((hD,wD,3))*0.2
 999
1000            back[hM:hM+h1,wM:wM+w1,:] = old.colorData*self.model.displayModel['scaling']
1001            back[hM:hM+h2,2*wM+w1:2*wM+w1+w2,:] = img.colorData*self.model.displayModel['scaling']
1002
1003            # save as temp.hdr
1004            colour.write_image(back,'temp.hdr', method='Imageio')
1005            self.displayFile('temp.hdr')
1006
1007            self.model.currentIMG = img
1008        else: self.callBackUpdate()
1009
1010    def displayFile(self, HDRfilename):
1011        """
1012        HDRviewerController display file: run HDRImageViewer process ti display HDR image (from filename)
1013
1014        Args:
1015            HDRfilename: string
1016                Required  : hdr image filename
1017                
1018        """
1019
1020         # check that no current display process already open
1021        if self.viewerProcess:
1022            # the display HDR process is already running
1023            # close current
1024            subprocess.run(['taskkill', '/F', '/T', '/IM', "HDRImageViewer*"],capture_output=False)
1025            time.sleep(0.05)
1026        # run display HDR process
1027        self.viewerProcess = subprocess.Popen(["HDRImageViewer.exe","-f", "-input:"+HDRfilename, "-f", "-h"], shell=True)
1028        time.sleep(0.10)
1029        psData = subprocess.run(['tasklist'], capture_output=True, universal_newlines=True).stdout
1030        if not 'HDRImageViewer' in psData: 
1031            # re-run display HDR process
1032            self.viewerProcess = subprocess.Popen(["HDRImageViewer.exe","-f", "-input:"+HDRfilename, "-f", "-h"], shell=True)
1033
1034    def displayIMG(self, img):
1035        img = img.process(hdrCore.processing.clip())
1036        print(self.model.scaling())
1037        colorData = img.colorData*self.model.displayModel['scaling']
1038
1039        h,w, _ = colorData.shape
1040        hD, wD = self.model.displayModel['shape']
1041
1042        if w<wD:
1043            back = np.ones((hD,wD,3))*0.2
1044            marginW = int((wD-w)/2)
1045            marginH = int((hD-h)/2)
1046
1047            back[marginH:marginH+h,marginW:marginW+w,:]=colorData
1048
1049        # save as temp.hdr
1050        colour.write_image(back,'temp.hdr', method='Imageio')
1051        self.displayFile('temp.hdr')
1052
1053    def displaySplash(self):
1054        self.model.currentIMG = None
1055        self.displayFile('grey.hdr')
1056
1057    def close(self):
1058        # check that no current display process already open
1059        if self.viewerProcess:
1060            # the display HDR process is already running
1061            # close current
1062            subprocess.run(['taskkill', '/F', '/T', '/IM', "HDRImageViewer*"],capture_output=False)
1063            self.viewerProcess = None

1110    def setValues(self, values, callBackActive = False):
1111        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> LchColorSelectorController.setValue(",values,") ")
1112
1113        self.callBackActive = callBackActive
1114        # slider hue selection
1115        v = values['selection']['hue'] if 'hue' in values['selection'].keys() else (0,360)
1116        self.view.sliderHueMin.setValue(int(v[0]))
1117        self.view.sliderHueMax.setValue(int(v[1]))
1118
1119        # slider chroma selection
1120        v = values['selection']['chroma'] if 'chroma' in values['selection'].keys() else (0,100)
1121        self.view.sliderChromaMin.setValue(int(v[0]))
1122        self.view.sliderChromaMax.setValue(int(v[1]))
1123
1124        # slider lightness
1125        v = values['selection']['lightness'] if 'lightness' in values['selection'].keys() else (0,100)
1126        self.view.sliderLightMin.setValue(int(v[0]*3))
1127        self.view.sliderLightMax.setValue(int(v[1]*3))
1128
1129        # hue shift editor
1130        v = values['edit']['hue'] if 'hue' in values['edit'].keys() else 0
1131        self.view.sliderHueShift.setValue(int(v))
1132        self.view.valueHueShift.setText(str(v)) 
1133
1134        # exposure editor
1135        v : int = values['edit']['exposure'] if 'exposure' in values['edit'].keys() else 0
1136        self.view.sliderExposure.setValue(int(v*30))
1137        self.view.valueExposure.setText(str(v)) 
1138
1139        # contrast editor
1140        v : int = values['edit']['contrast'] if 'contrast' in values['edit'].keys() else 0
1141        self.view.sliderContrast.setValue(int(v))
1142        self.view.valueContrast.setText(str(v))  
1143
1144        # saturation editor
1145        v : int = values['edit']['saturation'] if 'saturation' in values['edit'].keys() else 0
1146        self.view.sliderSaturation.setValue(int(v))
1147        self.view.valueSaturation.setText(str(v))  
1148
1149        # mask
1150        v : bool = values['mask'] if 'mask' in values.keys() else False
1151        self.view.checkboxMask.setChecked(values['mask'])             
1152
1153        self.model.setValues(values)
1154
1155        self.callBackActive = True
1156
1157    # -----

1160
1161        default = copy.deepcopy(self.model.default)
1162        current = copy.deepcopy(self.model.getValues())
1163        
1164        current['selection'] = default['selection']
1165
1166        self.setValues(current,callBackActive = True)
1167        self.callBackActive = True
1168

1171
1172        default = copy.deepcopy(self.model.default)
1173        current = copy.deepcopy(self.model.getValues())
1174        
1175        current['edit'] = default['edit']
1176
1177        self.setValues(current,callBackActive = True)

1274    # callbacks
1275    def auto(self): 
1276        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> ColorEditorsAutoController.auto(",") ")
1277        for ce in self.controlled: ce.resetSelection(); ce.resetEdit()
1278        values = self.model.compute()
1279
1280        if values != None:
1281            for i,v in enumerate(values): self.controlled[i].setValues(v, callBackActive = False)

134        currentPage = self.view.pageNumber
135        nbImagePerPage = GalleryMode.nbRow(self.view.shapeMode)*GalleryMode.nbCol(self.view.shapeMode)
136        selectedImage = self.model.selectedImage() if (self.model.selectedImage()!=-1) else currentPage*nbImagePerPage
137        newNbImagePerPage = GalleryMode.nbRow(newGalleryMode)*GalleryMode.nbCol(newGalleryMode)

211        idxProcessPipe = self.model.selectedImage()
212        nbImagePage = GalleryMode.nbRow(self.view.shapeMode)*GalleryMode.nbCol(self.view.shapeMode)
213        idxImageWidget = idxProcessPipe%nbImagePage
214        if pref.verbose:  print(" >> ImageGalleryController.setProcessPipeWidgetQPixmap(...)[ image id:",idxProcessPipe,">> image widget controller:",idxImageWidget,"]")
215        self.view.imagesControllers[idxImageWidget].setQPixmap(qPixmap)
def save(self): 
217    def save(self):
218        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> ImageGalleryController.save()")
219        self.model.save()
def currentPage(self):

def pageIdx(self):

224        nb = self.currentPage()
225        nbImagePage = GalleryMode.nbRow(self.view.shapeMode)*GalleryMode.nbCol(self.view.shapeMode)
226        return (nb*nbImagePage), ((nb+1)*nbImagePage)

class AppController: 
236class AppController(object):
237    """controller for MainWindow
238    
239        Attributes:
240            screenSize 
241            hdrDisplay 
242            view                          
243            model
244            
245        Methods:
246            callBackSelectDir(self)
247            callBackSave(self)
248            callBackDisplayHDR(self)
249            callBackEndDisplay(self, img)
250            callBackCloseDisplayHDR(self)
251            callBackCompareRawEditedHDR(self)
252            callBackExportHDR(self)
253            callBackEndExportHDR(self, img)
254            callBackExportAllHDR(self)            
255            callBackEndAllExportHDR(self, img)  
256
257    """
258
259    def __init__(self, app):
260        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> AppController.__init__()")
261
262        self.screenSize = getScreenSize(app)# get screens size
263
264        # attributes
265        self.hdrDisplay = HDRviewerController(self)
266        self.view =  view.AppView(self, HDRcontroller = self.hdrDisplay)                         
267        self.model = model.AppModel(self)
268
269        self.dirName = None
270        self.imagesName = []
271        
272        self.view.show()
273    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
274
275    def callBackSelectDir(self):
276        """Callback of export HDR menu: open file dialog, store image filenames (self.imagesName), set directory to model
277        """
278        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> AppController.callBackSelectDir()")
279        dirName = QFileDialog.getExistingDirectory(None, 'Select Directory', self.model.directory)
280        if dirName != "":
281            # save current images (metadata)
282            self.view.imageGalleryController.save()
283            # get images in the selected directory
284            self.imagesName = []; self.imagesName = list(self.model.setDirectory(dirName))
285
286            self.view.imageGalleryController.setImages(self.imagesName)
287            self.hdrDisplay.displaySplash()
288    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
289    def callBackSave(self): self.view.imageGalleryController.save()
290    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
291    def callBackQuit(self):
292        if pref.verbose: print(" [CB] >> AppController.callBackQuit()")
293        self.view.imageGalleryController.save()
294        self.hdrDisplay.close()
295        sys.exit()
296    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
297    def callBackDisplayHDR(self):
298
299        if pref.verbose:  print(" [CONTROL] >> AppController.callBackDisplayHDR()")
300
301        selectedProcessPipe = self.view.imageGalleryController.model.getSelectedProcessPipe()
302
303        if selectedProcessPipe:
304            self.view.statusBar().showMessage('displaying HDR image, full size image computation: start, please wait !')
305            self.view.statusBar().repaint()
306            # save current processpipe metada
307            originalImage = copy.deepcopy(selectedProcessPipe.originalImage)
308            originalImage.metadata.metadata['processpipe'] = selectedProcessPipe.toDict()
309            originalImage.metadata.save()
310
311            # load full size image
312            img = hdrCore.image.Image.read(originalImage.path+'/'+originalImage.name)
313
314            # turn off: autoResize
315            hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe.autoResize = False 
316            # make a copy of selectedProcessPipe  
317            processpipe = copy.deepcopy(selectedProcessPipe)
318
319            # set size to display size
320            size = pref.getDisplayShape()
321            img = img.process(hdrCore.processing.resize(),size=(None, size[1]))
322
323            # set image to process-pipe
324            processpipe.setImage(img)
325
326            thread.cCompute(self.callBackEndDisplay, processpipe, toneMap=False, progress=self.view.statusBar().showMessage)
327    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
328    def callBackEndDisplay(self, img):
329
330        if pref.verbose:  print(" [CONTROL] >> AppController.callBackEndDisplay()")
331
332        # turn off: autoResize
333        hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe.autoResize = True  
334        
335        self.view.statusBar().showMessage('displaying HDR image, full size image computation: done !')
336
337        # clip, scale
338        img = img.process(hdrCore.processing.clip())
339        img.colorData = img.colorData*pref.getDisplayScaling()
340
341        colour.write_image(img.colorData,"temp.hdr", method='Imageio') # local copy for display
342        self.hdrDisplay.displayFile("temp.hdr")
343    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
344    def callBackCloseDisplayHDR(self):
345        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> AppController.callBackCloseDisplayHDR()")
346        self.hdrDisplay.displaySplash()
347    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
348    def callBackCompareRawEditedHDR(self):
349        """
350        Callback of compare raw/edited HDR menu
351
352        Display side by side original image and edited version.        
353        """
354
355        if pref.verbose:  print(" [CONTROL] >> AppController.callBackCompareOriginalInputHDR()")
356
357        # process real size image
358        # get selected process pipe
359        selectedProcessPipe = self.view.imageGalleryController.model.getSelectedProcessPipe()
360
361        if selectedProcessPipe:         # check if a process pipe is selected
362
363            # read original image
364            img = hdrCore.image.Image.read(selectedProcessPipe.originalImage.path+'/'+selectedProcessPipe.originalImage.name)
365
366            # resize
367            screenY, screenX = pref.getDisplayShape()
368
369            imgY, imgX,_ = img.shape
370
371            marginY = int((screenY - imgY/2)/2)
372            marginX = int(marginY/4)
373            imgXp = int((screenX - 3*marginX)/2)
374            img = img.process(hdrCore.processing.resize(),size=(None,imgXp))
375            imgY, imgX, _ = img.shape
376
377            # original image after resize
378            ori = copy.deepcopy(img)
379
380            # build process pipe from selected one them compute
381            pp = hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe()
382            hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe.autoResize = False   # stop autoResize
383            params= []
384            for p in selectedProcessPipe.processNodes: 
385                pp.append(copy.deepcopy(p.process),paramDict=None, name=copy.deepcopy(p.name))
386                params.append({p.name:p.params})
387            img.metadata.metadata['processpipe'] = params
388            pp.setImage(img)
389
390            res = hdrCore.coreC.coreCcompute(img, pp)
391            res = res.process(hdrCore.processing.clip())
392            
393            imgYres, imgXres, _ = res.colorData.shape
394
395            hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe.autoResize = True    # return to autoResize
396
397            # make comparison image
398            oriColorData = ori.colorData*pref.getDisplayScaling()
399            resColorData = res.colorData*pref.getDisplayScaling()
400            display = np.ones((screenY,screenX,3))*0.2
401            marginY = int((screenY - imgY)/2)
402            marginYres = int((screenY - imgYres)/2)
403
404            display[marginY:marginY+imgY, marginX:marginX+imgX,:] = oriColorData
405            display[marginYres:marginYres+imgYres, 2*marginX+imgX:2*marginX+imgX+imgXres,:] = resColorData
406            
407            # save as compOrigFinal.hdr
408            colour.write_image(display,'compOrigFinal.hdr', method='Imageio')
409            self.hdrDisplay.displayFile('compOrigFinal.hdr')
410    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
411    def callBackExportHDR(self):
412        """
413        Callback of export HDR menu
414
415        Export the image associated to selected process pipe
416        """
417
418        if pref.verbose:  print(" [CONTROL] >> AppController.callBackExportHDR()") 
419
420        selectedProcessPipe = self.view.imageGalleryController.model.getSelectedProcessPipe()
421
422
423        if selectedProcessPipe:
424            # select dir where to save export
425            self.dirName = QFileDialog.getExistingDirectory(None, 'Select Directory where to export HDR file', self.model.directory)
426
427            # show export message
428            self.view.statusBar().showMessage('exporting HDR image ('+pref.getHDRdisplay()['tag']+'), full size image computation: start, please wait !')
429            self.view.statusBar().repaint()
430
431            # save current processpipe metada
432            originalImage = copy.deepcopy(selectedProcessPipe.originalImage)
433            originalImage.metadata.metadata['processpipe'] = selectedProcessPipe.toDict()
434            originalImage.metadata.save()
435
436            # load full size image
437            img = hdrCore.image.Image.read(originalImage.path+'/'+originalImage.name)
438
439            # turn off: autoResize
440            hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe.autoResize = False 
441            # make a copy of selectedProcessPipe  
442            processpipe = copy.deepcopy(selectedProcessPipe)
443
444            # set image to process-pipe
445            processpipe.setImage(img)
446
447            thread.cCompute(self.callBackEndExportHDR, processpipe, toneMap=False, progress=self.view.statusBar().showMessage)
448    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
449    def callBackEndExportHDR(self, img):
450        # turn off: autoResize
451        hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe.autoResize = True  
452        
453        self.view.statusBar().showMessage('exporting HDR image ('+pref.getHDRdisplay()['tag']+'), full size image computation: done !')
454
455        # clip, scale
456        img = img.process(hdrCore.processing.clip())
457        img.colorData = img.colorData*pref.getDisplayScaling()
458
459        if self.dirName:
460            pathExport = os.path.join(self.dirName, img.name[:-4]+pref.getHDRdisplay()['post']+'.hdr')
461            img.type = hdrCore.image.imageType.HDR
462            img.metadata.metadata['processpipe'] = None
463            img.metadata.metadata['display'] = pref.getHDRdisplay()['tag']
464
465            img.write(pathExport)
466
467        colour.write_image(img.colorData,"temp.hdr", method='Imageio') # local copy for display
468        self.hdrDisplay.displayFile("temp.hdr")
469    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
470    def callBackExportAllHDR(self):
471        if pref.verbose:  print(" [CONTROL] >> AppController.callBackExportAllHDR()")
472
473        self.processPipes = self.view.imageGalleryController.getProcessPipes()
474
475        # select dir where to save export
476        self.dirName = QFileDialog.getExistingDirectory(None, 'Select Directory where to export HDR file', self.model.directory)
477        self.view.statusBar().showMessage('exporting '+str(len(self.processPipes))+' HDR images ... please wait')
478        self.view.statusBar().repaint()
479        self.imageToExport = len(self.processPipes) ; self.imageExportDone = 0
480
481        pp = self.processPipes[0]
482
483        # save current processpipe metada
484        originalImage = copy.deepcopy(pp.originalImage)
485        originalImage.metadata.metadata['processpipe'] = pp.toDict()
486        originalImage.metadata.save()
487
488        # load full size image
489        img = hdrCore.image.Image.read(originalImage.path+'/'+originalImage.name)
490
491        # turn off: autoResize
492        hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe.autoResize = False 
493        # make a copy of selectedProcessPipe  
494        processpipe = copy.deepcopy(pp)
495
496        # set image to process-pipe
497        processpipe.setImage(img)
498
499        thread.cCompute(self.callBackEndAllExportHDR, processpipe, toneMap=False, progress=self.view.statusBar().showMessage)            
500    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
501    def callBackEndAllExportHDR(self, img):
502        # last image ?
503        self.imageExportDone +=1
504
505        self.view.statusBar().showMessage('exporting HDR images ('+pref.getHDRdisplay()['tag']+'):'+str(int(100*self.imageExportDone/self.imageToExport))+'% done !')
506
507        # clip, scale
508        img = img.process(hdrCore.processing.clip())
509        img.colorData = img.colorData*pref.getDisplayScaling()
510
511        if self.dirName:
512            pathExport = os.path.join(self.dirName, img.name[:-4]+pref.getHDRdisplay()['post']+'.hdr')
513            img.type = hdrCore.image.imageType.HDR
514            img.metadata.metadata['processpipe'] = None
515            img.metadata.metadata['display'] = pref.getHDRdisplay()['tag']
516
517            img.write(pathExport)
518
519        if self.imageExportDone == self.imageToExport :
520            # turn off: autoResize
521            hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe.autoResize = True
522        else:
523            pp = self.processPipes[self.imageExportDone]
524
525            if not pp:
526                img = hdrCore.image.Image.read(self.imagesName[self.imageExportDone], thumb=True)
527                pp = model.EditImageModel.buildProcessPipe()
528                pp.setImage(img)                      
529
530
531            # save current processpipe metada
532            originalImage = copy.deepcopy(pp.originalImage)
533            originalImage.metadata.metadata['processpipe'] = pp.toDict()
534            originalImage.metadata.save()
535
536            # load full size image
537            img = hdrCore.image.Image.read(originalImage.path+'/'+originalImage.name)
538
539            # turn off: autoResize
540            hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe.autoResize = False 
541            # make a copy of selectedProcessPipe  
542            processpipe = copy.deepcopy(pp)
543
544            # set image to process-pipe
545            processpipe.setImage(img)
546
547            thread.cCompute(self.callBackEndAllExportHDR, processpipe, toneMap=False, progress=self.view.statusBar().showMessage)

def callBackEndAllExportHDR(self, img): 
501    def callBackEndAllExportHDR(self, img):
502        # last image ?
503        self.imageExportDone +=1
504
505        self.view.statusBar().showMessage('exporting HDR images ('+pref.getHDRdisplay()['tag']+'):'+str(int(100*self.imageExportDone/self.imageToExport))+'% done !')
506
507        # clip, scale
508        img = img.process(hdrCore.processing.clip())
509        img.colorData = img.colorData*pref.getDisplayScaling()
510
511        if self.dirName:
512            pathExport = os.path.join(self.dirName, img.name[:-4]+pref.getHDRdisplay()['post']+'.hdr')
513            img.type = hdrCore.image.imageType.HDR
514            img.metadata.metadata['processpipe'] = None
515            img.metadata.metadata['display'] = pref.getHDRdisplay()['tag']
516
517            img.write(pathExport)
518
519        if self.imageExportDone == self.imageToExport :
520            # turn off: autoResize
521            hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe.autoResize = True
522        else:
523            pp = self.processPipes[self.imageExportDone]
524
525            if not pp:
526                img = hdrCore.image.Image.read(self.imagesName[self.imageExportDone], thumb=True)
527                pp = model.EditImageModel.buildProcessPipe()
528                pp.setImage(img)                      
529
530
531            # save current processpipe metada
532            originalImage = copy.deepcopy(pp.originalImage)
533            originalImage.metadata.metadata['processpipe'] = pp.toDict()
534            originalImage.metadata.save()
535
536            # load full size image
537            img = hdrCore.image.Image.read(originalImage.path+'/'+originalImage.name)
538
539            # turn off: autoResize
540            hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe.autoResize = False 
541            # make a copy of selectedProcessPipe  
542            processpipe = copy.deepcopy(pp)
543
544            # set image to process-pipe
545            processpipe.setImage(img)
546
547            thread.cCompute(self.callBackEndAllExportHDR, processpipe, toneMap=False, progress=self.view.statusBar().showMessage)

class ToneCurveController: 
754class ToneCurveController():
755    def __init__(self, parent):

759        self.view = view.ToneCurveView(self)

765        self.showAfter = False
766        self.showOutput = True
767
768        # zj add semi-auto curve
769        # machine learning network and weight file 
770        self.weightFile = 'MSESig505_0419.pth'
771        self.networkModel = None  
772    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
773    def sliderChange(self, key, value):
774        if pref.verbose: print(" [CB] >> ToneCurveController.sliderChange(",key,",",value,")[callBackActive:",self.callBackActive,"] ")
775

777            newValues = self.model.setValue(key, value, autoScale = False)

780            points = self.model.evaluate()
781

783
784            self.view.sliderShadows.setValue(int(newValues["shadows"][1]))
785            self.view.editShadows.setText(str(newValues["shadows"][1]))
786
787            self.view.sliderBlacks.setValue(int(newValues["blacks"][1]))
788            self.view.editBlacks.setText(str(newValues["blacks"][1]))
789
790            self.view.sliderMediums.setValue(int(newValues["mediums"][1]))
791            self.view.editMediums.setText(str(newValues["mediums"][1]))
792
793            self.view.sliderWhites.setValue(int(newValues["whites"][1]))
794            self.view.editWhites.setText(str(newValues["whites"][1]))
795
796            self.view.sliderHighlights.setValue(int(newValues["highlights"][1]))
797            self.view.editHighlights.setText(str(newValues["highlights"][1]))

799            self.callBackActive =  True

802        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> ToneCurveController.setValue(",valuesDict,") ")
803

805

807        points = self.model.evaluate()
808
809        self.view.sliderShadows.setValue(int(valuesDict["shadows"][1]))
810        self.view.editShadows.setText(str(valuesDict["shadows"][1]))
811

813        self.view.editBlacks.setText(str(valuesDict["blacks"][1]))
814
815        self.view.sliderMediums.setValue(int(valuesDict["mediums"][1]))
816        self.view.editMediums.setText(str(valuesDict["mediums"][1]))
817
818        self.view.sliderWhites.setValue(int(valuesDict["whites"][1]))
819        self.view.editWhites.setText(str(valuesDict["whites"][1]))
820
821        self.view.sliderHighlights.setValue(int(valuesDict["highlights"][1]))
822        self.view.editHighlights.setText(str(valuesDict["highlights"][1]))
823
824        self.callBackActive = True
825    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------     
826    # zj add for semi-auto curve begin
827    def autoCurve(self):
828        processPipe = self.parent.controller.model.getProcessPipe()
829        if processPipe != None :
830            idExposure = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("tonecurve")
831            bins = np.linspace(0,1,50+1)
832
833            imageBeforeColorData = processPipe.processNodes[idExposure-1].outputImage.colorData
834            imageBeforeColorData[imageBeforeColorData>1]=1
835            imageBeforeY = colour.sRGB_to_XYZ(imageBeforeColorData, apply_cctf_decoding=False)[:,:,1]
836            nphistBefore  = np.histogram(imageBeforeY, bins)[0]
837            nphistBefore  = nphistBefore/np.amax(nphistBefore)
838
839            npImgHistCumuNorm = np.empty_like(nphistBefore)
840            npImgHistCumu = np.cumsum(nphistBefore)
841            npImgHistCumuNorm = npImgHistCumu/np.max(npImgHistCumu)
842            
843            #predict keypoint value
844            if self.networkModel == None:
845                self.networkModel = Net(50,5)
846                self.networkModel.load_state_dict(torch.load(self.weightFile))
847                self.networkModel.eval()
848
849            with torch.no_grad():
850                x = Variable(torch.FloatTensor([npImgHistCumuNorm.tolist(),]), requires_grad=True)
851                y_predict = self.networkModel(x)
852
853            kpc = (y_predict[0]*100).tolist() 
854            kpcDict = {'start':[0.0,0.0], 'shadows': [10.0,kpc[0]], 'blacks': [30.0,kpc[1]], 'mediums': [50.0,kpc[2]], 'whites': [70.0,kpc[3]], 'highlights': [90.0,kpc[4]], 'end': [100.0,100.0]}
855            self.setValues(kpcDict,callBackActive = True)
856            self.parent.controller.changeToneCurve(kpcDict) 
857     
858    # zj add for semi-auto curve end   
859
860    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
861    def reset(self, key):
862        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> ToneCurveController.reset(",key,") ")
863

865        controls = self.model.setValue(key, valuesDefault)
866        self.setValues(controls,callBackActive = False)
867
868        self.parent.controller.changeToneCurve(controls) 
869    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
870    def plotCurve(self):
871        try:
872            self.view.curve.plot([0,100],[0,100],'r--', clear=True)
873            self.view.curve.plot([20,20],[0,100],'r--', clear=False)
874            self.view.curve.plot([40,40],[0,100],'r--', clear=False)
875            self.view.curve.plot([60,60],[0,100],'r--', clear=False)
876            self.view.curve.plot([80,80],[0,100],'r--', clear=False)
877
878            processPipe = self.parent.controller.model.getProcessPipe()
879            idExposure = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("tonecurve")
880
881            bins = np.linspace(0,1,50+1)
882
883            if self.showInput:
884                imageInput = copy.deepcopy(processPipe.getInputImage())
885                if imageInput.linear: imageInputColorData =colour.cctf_encoding(imageInput.colorData, function='sRGB')
886                else: imageInputColorData = imageInput.colorData
887                imageInputColorData[imageInputColorData>1]=1
888                imageInputY = colour.sRGB_to_XYZ(imageInputColorData, apply_cctf_decoding=False)[:,:,1]
889                nphistInput  = np.histogram(imageInputY, bins)[0]
890                nphistInput  = nphistInput/np.amax(nphistInput)
891                self.view.curve.plot(bins[:-1]*100,nphistInput*100,'k--',  clear=False)
892
893            if self.showbefore:
894                imageBeforeColorData = processPipe.processNodes[idExposure-1].outputImage.colorData
895                imageBeforeColorData[imageBeforeColorData>1]=1
896                imageBeforeY = colour.sRGB_to_XYZ(imageBeforeColorData, apply_cctf_decoding=False)[:,:,1]
897                nphistBefore  = np.histogram(imageBeforeY, bins)[0]
898                nphistBefore  = nphistBefore/np.amax(nphistBefore)
899                self.view.curve.plot(bins[:-1]*100,nphistBefore*100,'b--',  clear=False)
900
901            if self.showAfter:
902                imageAftercolorData = processPipe.processNodes[idExposure].outputImage.colorData
903                imageAftercolorData[imageAftercolorData>1]=1
904                imageAfterY  = colour.sRGB_to_XYZ(imageAftercolorData,  apply_cctf_decoding=False)[:,:,1]
905                nphistAfter   = np.histogram(imageAfterY, bins)[0]
906                nphistAfter   =nphistAfter/np.amax(nphistAfter)
907                self.view.curve.plot(bins[:-1]*100,nphistAfter*100,'b',     clear=False)
908
909            if self.showOutput:
910                imageAftercolorData = processPipe.getImage(toneMap=True).colorData
911                imageAftercolorData[imageAftercolorData>1]=1
912                imageAfterY  = colour.sRGB_to_XYZ(imageAftercolorData,  apply_cctf_decoding=False)[:,:,1]
913                nphistAfter   = np.histogram(imageAfterY, bins)[0]
914                nphistAfter   =nphistAfter/np.amax(nphistAfter)
915                self.view.curve.plot(bins[:-1]*100,nphistAfter*100,'b',     clear=False)
916
917            controlPointCoordinates= np.asarray(list(self.model.control.values()))
918            self.view.curve.plot(controlPointCoordinates[1:-1,0],controlPointCoordinates[1:-1,1],'ro', clear=False)
919            points = np.asarray(self.model.curve.evalpts)
920            x = points[:,0]
921            self.view.curve.plot(points[x<100,0],points[x<100,1],'r',clear=False)
922        except:
923            time.sleep(0.5)
924            self.plotCurve()

def autoCurve(self): 
827    def autoCurve(self):
828        processPipe = self.parent.controller.model.getProcessPipe()
829        if processPipe != None :
830            idExposure = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("tonecurve")
831            bins = np.linspace(0,1,50+1)
832
833            imageBeforeColorData = processPipe.processNodes[idExposure-1].outputImage.colorData
834            imageBeforeColorData[imageBeforeColorData>1]=1
835            imageBeforeY = colour.sRGB_to_XYZ(imageBeforeColorData, apply_cctf_decoding=False)[:,:,1]
836            nphistBefore  = np.histogram(imageBeforeY, bins)[0]
837            nphistBefore  = nphistBefore/np.amax(nphistBefore)
838
839            npImgHistCumuNorm = np.empty_like(nphistBefore)
840            npImgHistCumu = np.cumsum(nphistBefore)
841            npImgHistCumuNorm = npImgHistCumu/np.max(npImgHistCumu)
842            
843            #predict keypoint value
844            if self.networkModel == None:
845                self.networkModel = Net(50,5)
846                self.networkModel.load_state_dict(torch.load(self.weightFile))
847                self.networkModel.eval()
848
849            with torch.no_grad():
850                x = Variable(torch.FloatTensor([npImgHistCumuNorm.tolist(),]), requires_grad=True)
851                y_predict = self.networkModel(x)
852
853            kpc = (y_predict[0]*100).tolist() 
854            kpcDict = {'start':[0.0,0.0], 'shadows': [10.0,kpc[0]], 'blacks': [30.0,kpc[1]], 'mediums': [50.0,kpc[2]], 'whites': [70.0,kpc[3]], 'highlights': [90.0,kpc[4]], 'end': [100.0,100.0]}
855            self.setValues(kpcDict,callBackActive = True)
856            self.parent.controller.changeToneCurve(kpcDict)
def reset(self, key):

866        self.setValues(controls,callBackActive = False)

 961class HDRviewerController():

 975    def callBackUpdate(self):
 976        selectedProcessPipe = self.parent.view.imageGalleryController.model.getSelectedProcessPipe()
 977        img = selectedProcessPipe.getImage(toneMap = False)
 978        self.displayIMG(img)
 979        self.model.currentIMG = img

 981    def callBackAuto(self,on_off):
 982        self.parent.view.dock.view.childControllers[0].model.autoPreviewHDR = on_off
 983
 984    def callBackCompare(self):
 985        if self.model.currentIMG:
 986            old = self.model.currentIMG
 987            old = old.process(hdrCore.processing.clip())
 988
 989            sp = self.parent.view.imageGalleryController.model.getSelectedProcessPipe()
 990            img = sp.getImage(toneMap = False)
 991            img = img.process(hdrCore.processing.clip())
 992
 993
 994            h1, w1, _ = old.colorData.shape
 995            h2, w2, _ = img.colorData.shape
 996            hD, wD = self.model.displayModel['shape']
 997            hM = int((hD - max(h1,h2))/2)
 998            wM = int((wD - (w1+w2))/3)
 999            back =  np.ones((hD,wD,3))*0.2
1000
1001            back[hM:hM+h1,wM:wM+w1,:] = old.colorData*self.model.displayModel['scaling']
1002            back[hM:hM+h2,2*wM+w1:2*wM+w1+w2,:] = img.colorData*self.model.displayModel['scaling']
1003
1004            # save as temp.hdr
1005            colour.write_image(back,'temp.hdr', method='Imageio')
1006            self.displayFile('temp.hdr')
1007
1008            self.model.currentIMG = img
1009        else: self.callBackUpdate()
1010
1011    def displayFile(self, HDRfilename):
1012        """
1013        HDRviewerController display file: run HDRImageViewer process ti display HDR image (from filename)
1014
1015        Args:
1016            HDRfilename: string
1017                Required  : hdr image filename
1018                
1019        """
1020
1021         # check that no current display process already open
1022        if self.viewerProcess:
1023            # the display HDR process is already running
1024            # close current
1025            subprocess.run(['taskkill', '/F', '/T', '/IM', "HDRImageViewer*"],capture_output=False)
1026            time.sleep(0.05)
1027        # run display HDR process
1028        self.viewerProcess = subprocess.Popen(["HDRImageViewer.exe","-f", "-input:"+HDRfilename, "-f", "-h"], shell=True)
1029        time.sleep(0.10)
1030        psData = subprocess.run(['tasklist'], capture_output=True, universal_newlines=True).stdout
1031        if not 'HDRImageViewer' in psData: 
1032            # re-run display HDR process
1033            self.viewerProcess = subprocess.Popen(["HDRImageViewer.exe","-f", "-input:"+HDRfilename, "-f", "-h"], shell=True)
1034
1035    def displayIMG(self, img):
1036        img = img.process(hdrCore.processing.clip())
1037        print(self.model.scaling())
1038        colorData = img.colorData*self.model.displayModel['scaling']
1039
1040        h,w, _ = colorData.shape
1041        hD, wD = self.model.displayModel['shape']
1042
1043        if w<wD:
1044            back = np.ones((hD,wD,3))*0.2
1045            marginW = int((wD-w)/2)
1046            marginH = int((hD-h)/2)
1047
1048            back[marginH:marginH+h,marginW:marginW+w,:]=colorData
1049
1050        # save as temp.hdr
1051        colour.write_image(back,'temp.hdr', method='Imageio')
1052        self.displayFile('temp.hdr')
1053
1054    def displaySplash(self):
1055        self.model.currentIMG = None
1056        self.displayFile('grey.hdr')
1057
1058    def close(self):
1059        # check that no current display process already open
1060        if self.viewerProcess:
1061            # the display HDR process is already running
1062            # close current
1063            subprocess.run(['taskkill', '/F', '/T', '/IM', "HDRImageViewer*"],capture_output=False)
1064            self.viewerProcess = None

1056        self.displayFile('grey.hdr')
def close(self): 
1058    def close(self):
1059        # check that no current display process already open
1060        if self.viewerProcess:
1061            # the display HDR process is already running
1062            # close current
1063            subprocess.run(['taskkill', '/F', '/T', '/IM', "HDRImageViewer*"],capture_output=False)
1064            self.viewerProcess = None

1111    def setValues(self, values, callBackActive = False):
1112        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> LchColorSelectorController.setValue(",values,") ")
1113
1114        self.callBackActive = callBackActive
1115        # slider hue selection
1116        v = values['selection']['hue'] if 'hue' in values['selection'].keys() else (0,360)
1117        self.view.sliderHueMin.setValue(int(v[0]))
1118        self.view.sliderHueMax.setValue(int(v[1]))
1119
1120        # slider chroma selection
1121        v = values['selection']['chroma'] if 'chroma' in values['selection'].keys() else (0,100)
1122        self.view.sliderChromaMin.setValue(int(v[0]))
1123        self.view.sliderChromaMax.setValue(int(v[1]))
1124
1125        # slider lightness
1126        v = values['selection']['lightness'] if 'lightness' in values['selection'].keys() else (0,100)
1127        self.view.sliderLightMin.setValue(int(v[0]*3))
1128        self.view.sliderLightMax.setValue(int(v[1]*3))
1129
1130        # hue shift editor
1131        v = values['edit']['hue'] if 'hue' in values['edit'].keys() else 0
1132        self.view.sliderHueShift.setValue(int(v))
1133        self.view.valueHueShift.setText(str(v)) 
1134
1135        # exposure editor
1136        v : int = values['edit']['exposure'] if 'exposure' in values['edit'].keys() else 0
1137        self.view.sliderExposure.setValue(int(v*30))
1138        self.view.valueExposure.setText(str(v)) 
1139
1140        # contrast editor
1141        v : int = values['edit']['contrast'] if 'contrast' in values['edit'].keys() else 0
1142        self.view.sliderContrast.setValue(int(v))
1143        self.view.valueContrast.setText(str(v))  
1144
1145        # saturation editor
1146        v : int = values['edit']['saturation'] if 'saturation' in values['edit'].keys() else 0
1147        self.view.sliderSaturation.setValue(int(v))
1148        self.view.valueSaturation.setText(str(v))  
1149
1150        # mask
1151        v : bool = values['mask'] if 'mask' in values.keys() else False
1152        self.view.checkboxMask.setChecked(values['mask'])             
1153
1154        self.model.setValues(values)
1155
1156        self.callBackActive = True
1157
1158    # -----
1159    def resetSelection(self): 
1160        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> LchColorSelectorController.resetSelection(",") ")
1161
1162        default = copy.deepcopy(self.model.default)
1163        current = copy.deepcopy(self.model.getValues())
1164        
1165        current['selection'] = default['selection']
1166
1167        self.setValues(current,callBackActive = True)
1168        self.callBackActive = True
1169

class ColorEditorsAutoController: 
1263class  ColorEditorsAutoController:
1264    def __init__(self, parent, controlledColorEditors, stepName ):
1265        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> ColorEditorsAutoController.__init__(",") ")
1266
1267        self.parent = parent
1268        self.controlled = controlledColorEditors
1269        self.stepName =stepName
1270
1271        self.model =    model.ColorEditorsAutoModel(self, stepName,len(controlledColorEditors), removeBlack= True)
1272        self.view =     view.ColorEditorsAutoView(self)
1273
1274        self.callBackActive = True
1275    # callbacks
1276    def auto(self): 
1277        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> ColorEditorsAutoController.auto(",") ")
1278        for ce in self.controlled: ce.resetSelection(); ce.resetEdit()
1279        values = self.model.compute()
1280
1281        if values != None:
1282            for i,v in enumerate(values): self.controlled[i].setValues(v, callBackActive = False)
